column4: Please, I would appreciate if anyone can direct me in the right direction.
where is the place to discuss problems on usbfs
force the export?
Yes, usbfs exports the list of attached usb devices
But for some unknown reason, suddenly it stoped showing the list
what changed?
Changed thing is that i've attached a usb scanner, Epson GT7600
why turn acpi off?
My system seems to become unstable when it's on
did you try anything else or just that?
Problem occoured after attaching the scanner, everything lese is my default setup that has not changesd
Export if usbfs was there, showing all devices in the form if /proc/bus/usb/001/00X etc..
okay, you're just repeating what you told me, you're not answering my question, which means that I can't help you.
is the scanner the only device that's triggering the lack of output from the lsusb command?
okay - but now i'm asking you about the scanner.
how sure are you that acpi is the problem?
is this a laptop or desktop?
is the scanner plugged directly into the system or into a usb hub?
you could try pci=routeirq
for interrupt crash?
it doesn't crash, it re-arranges and handles them better - could be the reason why ACPI wasn't working right in the first place.
Ok, will try and reboot it with pci=routeirq. Bi the way, you wouldn't know how to force the speed of usb to 1.1, would you?
